intro: Strychnos psilosperma, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine despite their harmful properties. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
